result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia E Thunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alicia E Thunder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alicia E Thunder was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Alicia E Thunder was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Credit for 2 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must no consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must provide P&P with paperwork regarding recent inpatient treatment and Court leaves up to P&P for additional AODA.

Huber allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia E Thunder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: revoked - sentence to co jail/hoc

Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Alicia E Thunder in custody.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:04 AM. Also called 14TR727 (tracks with 15CM01), 15CM01 and 15CM10. On 14CF38 - here on SEHR and INIT on other two cases and STC on traffic matter. Ferguson has complaints on 15CM01 and 15CM10, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court will set both those matters and traffic matter for PTC on 4/7/15 at 11:00 AM. Court has reviewed the revocation package on 14CF38. State has revocation paperwork, does not see any errors or inaccuracies, 68 days credit, count #3 - recommends 7 months in FC jail - consecutive to 13CM302 that she is currently serving. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - believes the defendant is entitled to 73 days credit - recommends any sentence run concurrent to 13CM302 - State and Ferguson now stipulate to 74 days credit. Thunder makes statement, remorseful. Court puts on record that he was not the sentencing judge and would need a waiver from defendant to have him sentence her on the revocation portion. Off record at 10:20 AM to allow counsel to discuss the matter/waiver with the defendant. Back on record at 10:21 AM, defendant has waived the requirement that this court official review the transcripts of the original sentence prior to sentencing her on revocation, Court feels comfortable going forth with today's sentencing and sentences the defendant to the following: 7 months in FC jail - concurrent to 13CM302 - credit for 74 days - huber allowed, turn any unpaid financial obligations into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned. Court - 15CM10 - $1000.00 signature bond, amend bond on 15CM01 to $1000 signature bond, no consumption of intoxicants in any amount and no presence on any tavern premises.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-26-2015 10:00 am
Defendant is in custody at FOSO - sent notice to FOSO
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-24-2015 02:00 pm
In FOSO.
Notice of Assignment of Judge

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: copy given to Judge and JA for scheduling
of non payment: application for commitment order/license suspension/order

Called at 2:49 PM. Alicia Thunder appears in person and with counsel Amy Ferguson. State appears by Charles Simono. Ferguson - resolved and provies court with plea questionnaire - joint recommendation of the following: count #1 - amend to misd possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) - fine of $500 plus costs; #2 - dismissed; #3 - NC as alleged - withheld sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conidtions of: AODA, absolute sobriety, no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school; #4 - DRI. State agrees, moves to amend count #1 to misd possession of THC, moves to dismiss count #2 and moves to DRI count #4. Thunder agrees. Court amends count #1 to misd possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) - reads new penalties - pleads NC to amended count #1. Court dismisses count #2 and dismisses and reads in count #4. Thunder pleads NC to count #3 as alleged. Court has plea qestionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Thunder makes statement, remorseful. Ferguson provides court with a letter of recommendation from the treatment program that the defendant just completed. Court reviews letter. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $500 fine plus costs totalling $1555.50 - take bond posted - paid at rate of $100.00/month commencing 11/15/14; count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: costs - paid thru probation, provide P&P with paperwork regarding recent inpatient treatment and left up to P&P for AODA, maintain/obtain full time employment with verbage, no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain absolute sobriety, 2 days credit only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
Defendant's: Unlawful Stop and Detention

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 1:31 PM. Also called 13CM302. Alicia Thunder appears in person and with counsel Amy Ferguson. State appears by Charles Simono. Ferguson has criminal complaint on 14CF38 - waives reading, waives time limits, set for PH. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 7/2/14 at 3:00 PM. 13CM302 - State - have resolution - amend #1 to county ordinacne of DC with motor vehicle, plead as alleged to count #2, #3 - DRI, plead to count #1 with $500 fine plus costs, plead to #2 as alleged, probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, emnployment/school, 75 hours of community service. Ferguson and Thunder agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Court amends #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle. Thunder pleads NC on count #1, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totallling $834.50 - take bond posted, remainder due in 30 days/CO. Thunder pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Ferguson - follow joint recommendation. Thunder makes statement, remorseful, needs treatment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: impose 9 months in FC jail, stayed, place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: 90 days conditonal jail - stayed for 30 days - must be full time employed within 30 days or report to jail and if quit any full time job during probation - must serve 90 days in jail, court costs - paid within the first day days of probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars,  maintain/obtain full time employment/school and needs to be full time employed throughout entire time of probation or will be revoked, attend at least two AA/NA or similar treatment programs each week, 75 hours of community service, right to appeal, adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 9:27 AM. Alicia Thunder appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Thunder has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Thunder wants an attorney, can afford her own, will be hiring Amy Ferguson. Court will track this matter with her other criminal matter that is set for 5/14/14 at 10:00 AM. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 5/14/14 at 10:00 AM.
No consumption of alcohol.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
